body.name: FITLY Soft Flask - 5 oz (150 ml)- Shrink As You Drink Pocket Soft Water Bottle for Hydration Pack/Running Vest- Folding Water Bottle for Running, Hiking, Cycling - Ski Water Bottles (FLASK150)

features: HYDRATION ON THE MOVE: Our collapsible running soft flask is a compact and eco-friendly way to stay hydrated on the move! The soft water bottle is the perfect hydration tool for active individuals. Our soft water bottles for runners shrink as you drink, taking up minimal space and won’t slosh around, making it perfect for running, hiking, skiing or any rigorous activity.

SHRINKS AS YOU DRINK: Our running vest water bottle is uniquely designed to shrink as you drink. This ensures the water doesn’t slosh around, bounce or rattle. The flexible design of our hydration flask shapes to your hand & body, meaning the soft flask is never unwieldy. Our flexible running flask features an intelligent bite valve & leak-resistant mouthpiece.

STAY LIGHT ON YOUR FEET: FITLY’s collapsible flask is purposely lightweight ensuring your light on your feet and not weighted down by unnecessary bulk. At FITLY, reusability is deeply important to us, and our water bladder is no exception. Enjoy limitless use from our portable soft water bottle for running vest that is 100% BPA & PVC-free.

HYDRATION ON THE MOVE: Our soft flask is specially crafted for vigorous activities such as running, hiking, cycling and climbing. The perfect sporting companion, take it everywhere with you! Our soft water bottle can be folded and tucked into your pocket or bag. Our soft flask water bottle comes in 5 size variations and are freezable so they can double as an ice pack.

DIRECTIONS FOR USE: We recommend rinsing the flask thoroughly before first use. If you experience taste mix ½ a teaspoon of BAKING SODA with water, shake and rinse. Users have also found the following to be useful: Fill with MILK, shake, and rinse. Add drops of lemon. Let an orange peel or tea bag set in the flask for a couple of hours. To hydrate, simply softly bite the mouthpiece and press the soft flask and enjoy! The harder you press, the faster the liquid will exit.
body.description: Made to be used when you move Softly bite the mouthpiece.Press the flask.Suck on the goodness! The more you press, the faster the liquid will exit. The walls collapse as you drink, letting you absorb almost 100% of its content. Super useful for runners and vigorous activities. No liquid bounce Soft bite to quick flow Leak resistant and rigid cap ring for easy refill Durable, built to last No detectable plastic odor or taste

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: FITLY FLASKS are small collapsible soft flasks part of FITLY's product range of premium running accessories, first launched on Kickstarter.

FITLY Soft Flasks Ideal for quick drinks on the run. Gobble up a gel, wet a dry throat, or re-hydrate. Designed to be used while running. Store directly in your front, side, or back pockets. The flasks shrink as you drink so nothing ever moves, bounces or rattles. 5 models to choose from: FLASK150 (5oz): small enough to fit in small pockets for quick access.FLASK250 (8.5oz): a compromise between size and volume.FLASK350 (12oz): same width as the FLASK250 but a little longer.FLASK400 (13.5oz): go a little farther. Take a little more.FLASK500 (17oz): used as a stand-alone soft flask or with tubing (included). Note that FLASK500 comes with FITLY Sub90 and is too big for FITLY Sub45. IMPORTANT: Soft Flasks are NOT MADE for viscous substances like a gel (typically self-serving anyways) but flowing liquids. Many runners use a mixture of water and gel. Not as thick and transits better through the mouthpiece. The flasks are all sealed by hands. Expect volume variations up to 1 oz (up or down).

FLASK500 All the fun stuffs and some tips: Keep it cool longer. Leave it in the fridge or the freezer.Mix a gel with water to add some energy or squeeze a lemon for taste.Top rack dish-washer compatible.Wash it thoroughly prior to first use. <5% of people experience a taste. Rinse with baking soda until it disappears. Made to be used when you move Softly bite the mouthpiece.Press the flask.Suck on the goodness! The more you press, the faster the liquid will exit. The walls collapse as you drink, letting you absorb almost 100% of its content. Super useful for runners and vigorous activities. No liquid bounce Soft bite to quick flow Leak resistant and rigid cap ring for easy refill Durable, built to last No detectable plastic odor or taste

Compatible with FITLY Innovative Running Packs, hydration vests, running belts and back packs. Clever bite valve Durable and leak resistant mouthpiece. Make sure to twist the mouthpiece shut so it does not leak! Add natural oil to the thread to increase the seal if need be. Fits in front, side or back pockets A variety of flask sizes made for a wider range of activities. From 5 to 17 oz. Surprisingly easy to use! Thoroughly tested and re-tested. The mouthpiece has a hard and soft part, gently bite the soft part and liquid will gush out. FLASK500 + tube 17oz soft flask + 2 mouthpieces: 1 to use the flask as a stand-alone1 with a 45 deg rotating mouthpiece and a 23 inch tubing system

FLASK150 FLASK250 FLASK350 FLASK400 FLASK500 Size in In 5.5 x 2.75 7.5 x 3.5 8.75 x 3.5 8 x 4 8.5 x 6 Volume 5oz - 150ml 8.5oz - 250ml 12oz - 350ml 13.5oz - 400ml 17oz - 500ml SRP 10 USD 13 USD 14 USD 15 USD 25 USD

Statements from actual users: "My mouth gets super dry quickly and must always carry water with me. I didn't want to carry a big, clumsy water bottle". "Everything about this flask is awesome from the soft yet grippy texture to the bite nipple". "Works like a charm". "Overall product is exactly as advertised". "The flask is the perfect size during runs". "It's durable, high-quality material, and cleans well. Would highly recommend!". "Amazing product, just bought the second one" "The bite valve works great". "No detectable plastic odor". See Product Reviews for complete statements. . The important footnotes: Since the Flasks must seal properly to function, make sure to TWIST it shut. Apply natural oil to the threads to increase the seal. All prices are for 1 (one) flask.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to carry
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my husband to take skiing in his pocket. This soft material is so easy to carry and a good size for a day pack or pocket. He loves it. Easy to clean too!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for running
reviews.reviewText: It’s the perfect size to fit in my fanny pack for my long runs. Fits a lot of water and helped during my half marathon when water stations were far apart

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Pros and cons
reviews.reviewText: Pros: 1) I wanted something small that my husband and I could carry in our pockets during our daily 5 mile walks. This is perfect. As you can see in the pic, it is slim enough to put in your back pocket.2) We freeze them with the water inside (leaving room for expansion), so it is extra nice on a hot day to have what is basically an ice pack. The pic shows the water frozen inside. I like holding my bottle against the back of my neck to cool me off, and it speeds up the melting process so that I have some water to drink fairly quickly. My husband keeps his in his back pocket for most of our walk, so his remains partially frozen the entire time, but he still has water to drink.Cons: 1) I can’t get the spout to work. I know you’re supposed to bite the soft part gently but even when I do that, squeezing the bottle gently, barely anything dribbles out. So I just remove the cap and drink it that way. No big deal — I like getting a bigger swig of water. It doesn’t drip out of the spout, so that’s good. My husband can drink out of the spout with no problem.2) There is a slight rubber taste. Like drinking out of a rubber ball. I washed the bottles with baking soda and water, and it helped a bit. My husband doesn’t notice it as much as I do. But if you add some powdered, flavored Pedialyte to the water, then it tastes great and it gives you more electrolytes too!These bottles were perfect for our needs despite the cons.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I used this bottle a few times last year for travel and it was great. I tried it again a few months later, and it leaked all inside my coat before I realized. No matter how hard I try and screw the cap on, or readjust it, it still drips when hung upside down or squeezed. Cannot use it now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Light and comfortable
reviews.reviewText: Size perfect for a short hike or quick run, there's a plastic taste at the beginning but a cleaning tablet did the trick

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Perfect pocket-sized water bladder for hydration while skiing. Problem is poor tasting water.
reviews.reviewText: Expert skier who previously used water bladders with tube fed through the backpack for hydration while skiing. On cold days, the tube would freeze to my dismay. Nothing I could do to fix this issue worked. I tried insulated tubing without success. I then started carrying a 500 mL bottle of water each day in my thigh bib pocket which worked in terms of not freezing, although I found the shape of the bottle uncomfortable. I ordered this soft flask at the 400 mL size as I thought it would fit in my pocket and yes, it does. I fill it when I go in for a brief break and it is fine for resort use. Would this work for backcountry? Well, personally 400 mL isn't enough water for me for more than a few hours so I think this will have to stay for resort use. But for what I need, it works perfectly. The reason I gave it 3 rather than 5 stars is the taste of the water... despite filling it initially with hot, soapy water to clean, I still taste would I would best describe as the inside rubber/plastic taste/smell of a pool toy. If you have ever blown up a pool toy, you know what I mean. With time it has been getting better but the taste remains. On the product it is clearly advertised that the product is safe for use with claims of product safety by FDA, but who knows...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect way to carry your own sip of water!
reviews.reviewText: I love this little thing! It never leaks and is easy to carry in my bag. Great to be able to take pills throughout the day. The first one I received was defective with a horrible smell. The return was easy, and I got my replacement quickly. This new one was perfect- no smell at all- I would recommend it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just what I needed
reviews.reviewText: I need water on me for long runs so this was perfect. I can fit it in my vest / pouch or even hold it comfortably for 10+ miles. I will probably get a second one : ) I have had zero problems with it so far!Update: I got a second one in black (first one was blue) and the material seems thinner for the black one. I haven't used it yet but it didn't leak when I washed it so I think it'll be fine but maybe something to keep in mind. The blue one seems more durable. I will update again as I will be using both tomorrow (one for water, one for electrolytes).

Good size and perfect for running as it fits in my running belt... But there is a nasty plastic taste that is hard to wash out. I tried leaving vinegar inside all night and that reduced the taste, but it still lingers. Makes me wonder if this is actually safe to use.
It's really useful but tested like plastic

I love using soft water bottles because they don't take up much space. They are lightweight, flexible and collapsable which is ideal for when I go running! And this one fits perfectly into my waist bag :) It's also leakproof and I did not notice any bad taste in my water plus I really like this type of mouthpiece!

I have used it for a week and i5 worked great. No leak. It’s so small so I don’t feel it in my pocket. Some reviews complained about the smell. What I did was filling in dark tea, leave it for 8-10 hrs, and then leave it uncapped for 8-10 hrs. Repeat it. Now I don’t smell the plastic anymore.

Después de probar varias marcas y precios, entre ellas las de decathlon, os puedo asegurar que esta pequeña y flexible botellita es cómoda de llevar en bolsillos de mallas o mochilas de Trail. Lo mejor de todo es que el agua NI SABE a plástico, como si me pasaba con las anteriores compradas. Muy recomendable. También he vomitado la de 500 ml.
